com.google.zxing.qrcode.decoder

Class DataMask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.zxing.qrcode.decoder.DataMask
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataMask.DataMask000, DataMask.DataMask001, DataMask.DataMask010, DataMask.DataMask011, DataMask.DataMask100, DataMask.DataMask101, DataMask.DataMask110, DataMask.DataMask111

    abstract class DataMask
extends java.lang.Object

    Encapsulates data masks for the data bits in a QR code, per ISO 18004:2006 6.8. Implementations of this class can un-mask a raw BitMatrix. For simplicity, they will unmask the entire BitMatrix, including areas used for finder patterns, timing patterns, etc. These areas should be unused after the point they are unmasked anyway.

    Note that the diagram in section 6.8.1 is misleading since it indicates that i is column position and j is row position. In fact, as the text says, i is row position and j is column position.

    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask000
      000: mask bits for which (x + y) mod 2 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask001
      001: mask bits for which x mod 2 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask010
      010: mask bits for which y mod 3 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask011
      011: mask bits for which (x + y) mod 3 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask100
      100: mask bits for which (x/2 + y/3) mod 2 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask101
      101: mask bits for which xy mod 2 + xy mod 3 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask110
      110: mask bits for which (xy mod 2 + xy mod 3) mod 2 == 0
      private static class  DataMask.DataMask111
      111: mask bits for which ((x+y)mod 2 + xy mod 3) mod 2 == 0

      (package private) void unmaskBitMatrix(BitMatrix bits, int dimension)

    • Method Detail

      • unmaskBitMatrix

        final void unmaskBitMatrix(BitMatrix bits,
                   int dimension)

        Implementations of this method reverse the data masking process applied to a QR Code and make its bits ready to read.

        Parameters:
        bits - representation of QR Code bits
        dimension - dimension of QR Code, represented by bits, being unmasked

      • isMasked

        abstract boolean isMasked(int i,
               int j)

      • forReference

        static DataMask forReference(int reference)
        Parameters:
        reference - a value between 0 and 7 indicating one of the eight possible data mask patterns a QR Code may use
        Returns:
        DataMask encapsulating the data mask pattern
